title: critique needed for Ethiopian type face
content:
Hello,

I´m transferring my sketches to fontlab , here´s an image with a sample... and i would like some serious critiques to keep me going with my design.  
I am very much interested how my inflicting points going to affect hinting .  
Thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417185310im_/http:/typophile.com/files/My_Font%20_6311.jpg)
author: Aleme

comments.content: well, it seems easier to critique ethiopian writing being fluent on it, but sadly it's not my case... :/ - anyway i have also very curious about these non-latin writings, like from ethiopian, armenian, georgian, etc. - anyway they seems to have a good balance among thin and thick strokes, but there seems the stroke edges at 5th and 6th characters are not too much defined as they are on the 3rd, which i don't know how intentional are them?
